task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 30°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the height of the building, I should first look up to see the top of the structure, as my current pitch is level with the horizon.
I can see the top of the building now, but to estimate the height accurately, I need to view the building from a better angle; moving forward might help.
I should move forward to get a closer view of the building, which will help in estimating its height more accurately.
I should look down to see the base of the building, which will help me estimate the total height from ground to roof.
I can now see the base of the building; I should estimate the height based on the visible structure from ground to roof.
